title.narrative: EFFECTIVE SERVICES AT LOCAL LEVEL

description.narrative: By the end of 2016, relevant state authorities ensure that professionals from social protection, health and education sectors effectively provide services at local level for vulnerable boys and girls in line with national standards, which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Learning Outcomes, Maternal And Newborn Health, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2016, Montenegro addresses disparities and gaps in access to quality social services for excluded and vulnerable boys, girls and families in line with UN standards

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2016, relevant state authorities ensure that professionals from social protection, health and education sectorseffectively provide services at local level for vulnerable boys and girls in line with national standards

description.narrative: Preschool for All Campaign contributed to increased enrolment of children by 22% on average in 6 targeted municipalities, in comparison to 2015. The continuation of the child care system reform encompassed stronger involvement of the health sector in the reform, increased capacity of professionals and expansion of community based services. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2017

title.narrative: By 2016 all CSWs apply case management methodology in working with vulnerable boys and girls and families
All maternity wards in Montenegro apply Clinical guidelines for service provision related to perinatal care

actual.value: 2015:Four national guidelines on perinatal care adopted (Neonatal jaundice, Care of healthy women and their babies during childbirth, Routine postnatal care of women and their babies and on cesarean section). Guidelines are introduced in all maternity wards, however its application is still to be evaluat

actual.value: 2016:The ratio of trained professionals has been reached.
